cab.content: SEC RE T.BATTLE SITUATION r MORNING ^ 17th APRIL, 1918.1. On the Nsrthern Battle Front a French Division carried out a successful attack and advanced their line half-way to BAILLEUL on the METEREN - BAILLEUL road. Australians als^ attacked North of MERRIS and made a small advance, c ap turing pri s one rs 0North & NEUVE^EGLISE our patrols were able to reach a point 3,000 yards South-east of KEMEL without meeting any resistance from the enemy.The situation in the neighbourhood of WYTSCHAETS is not quite clearo The French have taken over a part of the lino In this neighbourhood,-,There was a heavy bombardment on the front from KEMMEL to METEREN at 5 acm0 this morning., but by 8,10 a0m0 it had -died- down. It is not yet known whether an infantry attack followedo*2* During the night we projected 400 gas drums into CITE DU NORD (LENS),30 Weather is reported to be fine and inclined to be misty.,General StaffsWar Office, S.W.I. 17th April, 1918,Issued at 12,30 p*m.
